free: #e Long time ago, I grew up to be a young man here.
#c 我從前在這裡長成青年。
#n hini refers to Gluban/指「清流部落」。
#e When I was seventeen, I volunteered to join the Japanese army.
#c 我十七歲的時候自願加入日本軍隊。
#n tanah 'red 紅色', tunux 'head 頭' 日軍帽沿是紅色。
#e Then I joined the marine corps of their voluteer force.
#c 然後我加入了他們自願軍中的海軍陸戰隊。
#n This army was called Takasago Volunteer Force./當時的自願軍又稱高砂義勇軍。
#e I went to Taichung for training for three months.
#c 我去台中訓練了三個月。
#e Then we went to Kaohsiung from Taiwan here.
#c 然後我們就從台灣這裡去了高雄。
#n Taywang should be Taicu. ‘台灣’其實是‘台中’（口誤）。
#e We passed the Philippines and stayed there for three months.
#c 我們經過菲律賓，而且在那裡待了三個月。
#e We passed Palau, and from Palau we went to Rabaul.
#c 我們經過帛琉，然後從帛琉去了拉包爾。
#n do should be de/ do應該是 de. 然後
#c 離開拉包爾之後，我們分離了。
#n hida should be hii di/ hida應該是hii di.
#e I went to Solomon Islands near New Guineas, and all stayed there.
#c 我去新幾內亞附近的索羅門群島，所有的人就留在那裡。
#e As for those who accompanied me there, we have never seen each other since.
#c 跟我一起去的那些人呢，我們再也沒見過了。
#e I stayed in Solomon Islands until seventeenth year of Showa (1942), no, until Showa twenty something (around 1945).
#c 我待在索羅門群島一直到昭和十七年，不，昭和二十幾年。
#e Then it was Restoration. Since then, I had stayed in the south.
#c 然後是就是光復，從那時候我就一直留在南方。
#e We were stuck there like rats. Being chased, (we) hid and fled, just like rats.
#c 我們就像老鼠被困在那裡。因為被追逐，（我們）像老鼠一樣躲藏起來。
#e Then what did we eat when staying here?
#c 那麼我們在這裡吃什麼？
#e We stayed there for five years, and we ate the roots of papaya trees and banana trees, and coconuts.
#c 我們待在那邊五年，我們吃木瓜樹的根、香蕉樹的根和椰子。
#n kawas 'this year 今年'. knkawas 'age, (in which) year 年齡、...(數字)年'。
#e Afterwards, we went to the place we had stayed.
#c 之後，我們去我們待過的地方。
#e With tools we set up traps and ate boars.
#c 我們用工具去放陷阱，吃野豬。
#e We planted taro, sweet potato and cassava.
#c 然後我們種芋頭，蕃薯和木薯。
#e There we ate like pigs. (We) must cook with big pots.
#c 我們在那裡吃像豬一樣，一定用大鍋煮。
#e Like mixing everything with the boar we caught.
#c 像是把所有東西和獵到的野豬（肉）混在一起。
#e Thus we were slightly filled, and our bodies became better.
#c 因此我們吃飽了一些，我們身體也好一點。
#e Since the Japanese people started the war and came to Taiwan we had lived like beggars.
#c 自從日本人打仗，來台灣之後，我們生活像乞丐一樣。
#e We had nothing, not even clothes.
#c 我們什麼都沒有，也沒有衣服。
#e How were our clothes enough? We only had one military uniform.
#c 我們衣服怎麼夠？我們的軍服就只有一套。
#e Two shirts to wear for five years.
#e There was nothing. All were ragged.
#e During that time we were naked again. We had no cloth.
#c 那段時間我們再一次變成裸體，沒有衣服了。
#e In the beginning, we went to the war only in loincloth.
#c 剛開始，我們去打仗只穿著兜襠布。
